questiontext.text:
Exercise

    The figures below show plots of the functions

    \((\text{a})\,\,y=\sin x,\quad (\text{b})\,\,y=2\sin x,\quad (\text{c})\,\,y=\cos x,\quad\text{and}\quad (\text{d})\,\,y=\cos\dfrac{x}{2}\) 




    State the correct amplitude, frequency, and period for the four functions:

  1. The amplitude is [[1]], the frequency is [[5]]\(\pi\), and the period if [[9]]\(\pi\).

  2. The amplitude is [[1]], the frequency is [[5]]\(\pi\), and the period if [[9]]\(\pi\).
  3. The amplitude is [[2]], the frequency is [[5]]\(\pi\), and the period if [[9]]\(\pi\).
  4. The amplitude is [[1]], the frequency is [[6]]\(\pi\), and the period if [[10]]\(\pi\).

generalfeedback.text:
In general, functions of the form

\(y=a\sin(bx),\quad\text{and}\quad y=a\cos(bx)\)

Have amplitude equal to \(a\), frequency equal to \(\dfrac{b}{2\pi}\), and period equal to \(\dfrac{2\pi}{b}\).
